main.name: Hannah Lopez
main.description: I am a private credit analyst interested in the intersection of finance and the tech industry. Welcome to my home base on the internet
main.bio: I graduated from Haverford College with a B.A. in Economics in May 2022. I took a job at KKR as a private credit analyst, and I started in July 2022. I enjoy learning about fun new things in tech and the world around me, and am excited to contribute my skills across collaborative projects.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out to me using this form and I'll get back to you ASAP.

resume.skillmessage: Some of my skills with a somewhat arbitrary graphic representation of my competence.

education.description: Studied Analytical Methods for Economics, Corporate Finance, Statistics, and more. Completed the Pre-Medicine track and minored in Psychology.
Graduated high school having focused on biology and english.

work.title: Private Credit Analyst
work.description: Learned key criteria for credit underwriting in an industry agnostic role. Spearheaded creating and presenting underwriting memos to senior team members, and our KKR Credit portfolio managers. Experienced in creating and maintaining financial models that include detailed revenue and FCF builds to demonstrate various sensitivity cases based on company-specific unit economics

work.title: Private Credit 2021 Summer Analyst
work.description: Gained hands-on experience building investment memos and models to evaluate and develop investment criteria for companies across various industries. Guided through investment fundamentals by an associate on the deal team, and tested my knowledge with an individual final presentation consolidating information from a fulsome data room to create and present a memo and model.

work.title: Insurance Portfolio Management Summer Intern
work.description: Remote intern working in the insurance portfolio management sector. Worked on projects, took notes on team calls, and learned about insurance investments. Received training in Bloomberg and Aladdin.

work.company: Girls Who Invest: Virtual Summer Intensive Program hosted by UCLA Anderson
work.title: Student
work.description: Completed a highly selective, rigorous 4-week training program focused on core investment concepts and skills taught by leading business school professors and investment professionals. Coursework and case studies included accounting, valuation, financial modeling, Bloomberg terminal, asset allocation, presentation and business etiquette skills.

projects.title: Routerunner
projects.category: A react web app to recommend credit cards based on a user's most frequest flight route

projects.title: Thar She Blows
projects.category: A very simple DaisyUI web app to check the timing of transit routes I care about In San Francisco

projects.title: Olomi Afghan Artist
projects.category: An artist's website that I helped to build when he needed to br promoted for an auction fundraiser for a nonprofit

projects.title: My Corne Keyboard Layout
projects.category: I'm very interested in small ergonomic keyboards, this is the repo for my latest layout
